body: @TianlinZhou I may need some help here, can not quite reproduce the problem with 2.8.4.
Actually, never mind, got it. While Jackson itself never writes such values (which is also why no unit tests noticed this issue), I can manually construct such input value.
Was able to fix this and related cases (int64 has similar issue).

issue.title: [cbor] Invalid value returned for negative int32 where the absolute value is > 2^31 - 1

repository.name: jackson-dataformats-binary
repository.description: Uber-project for standard Jackson binary format backends: avro, cbor, ion, protobuf, smile
